label: Form letter from Isaiah Bennett in regards to soliciting advertisements for the A. Philip Randolph Institute Annual Conference

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
CHARLESTON CHAPTER
OF THE
A. Philip Randolph Institute
119 SPRING STREET
UPSTAIRS
CHARLESTON, SOUTH CAROLINA 29403

January 9, 1980

Dear Sir:

This is to certify that         is authorized to
solicit ads for the S.C. [South Carolina] A. Philip Randolph Institute Banquet Souvenir
Booklet.

The South Carolina A. Philip Randolph Institute will have it's
third Annual Conference and Banquet, March 21 thru 23, 1980 at the
Francis Marion Hotel, Charleston, South Carolina.

The objectives of the A. Philip Randolph Institute are: To encourage
and expand political activites at the state, local and national
levels of government, to further this goal the Institute is involed [sic]
in: (a) Registering Voters.
(b) Organzing non-partisan - get-out the vote drive; and
(c) Voter Education, and to encourage and expand the labor movement.

To make this conference a success, we are asking that you assist
us in this endeavor by taking an ad. Ads are as follows:

(1) On e full page --- 100.00 [dollars]
(2) One half page --- 50.00 [dollars]
3) One fourth page --- 25.00 [dollars]
4) One eight page --- 12.50 [dollars]
(5) Patron --- 2.00 per name. [dollars]

All Donations and/or contributions are tax deductible.

We would like to hear from you no later than February 28, 1980.
Thanking you in advance for your time, support and Cooperation.

Sincerely,
Isaiah Bennett
Isaiah Bennett,
President

P.S. Make all checks payable to the
S.C. [South Carolina] A. Philip Randolph Institute
